channel.title: [CONTEST] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K18!
channel.description:
Hi, everybody! ;P This is DHO speakin'. We're getting into Summer, and with three Auxy tournaments done, it's time to relax. Right? Nope. :innocent:
We're doing a summer tournament! @Andrew_Adams will be returning as the co-host.
This will work the same as usual, though with a bit of a twist on the challenges. If you aren't familiar here's the deal-
How it Works - So, as stated in the previous tournament: Players 1-4 are in the tournament. Player 1 ends up against Player 2, and 3 against 4. If Player 1 beats 2, and Player 4 beats 3, then the two winners (1 and 4) will compete.
In this instance, however, there are 32 players.
Judging - You will be judged out of ten points in the following categories:
Creativity - How unique is the song compared to other Auxy tracks? It's good to have a balance. Sure you can randomly place notes and make automation, and, although it may be different, it's not necessarily pleasing to listen to.
Composition - How good is the actual composition, when you take out all the automation etc.?
Accuracy: How much you stuck to the challenge's rules.
Execution: How well did you execute all the ideas you tried to pull off? How is the instrument choice? Mixing?
Challenges - This time around the challenges will have special summer related themes. ;P You'll have to stay tuned to find out just what we mean by that, though. :upside_down_face:
Prizes - The two finalists will get a :unicorn: to display next to your username.
Always next time - Running tournaments is sort of a hobby of mine, so if you can't enter this time around, it's not too late. There will be a fifth Auxy Tournament. This is the last tournament of 2018 though so keep that in mind. :) ___________
Visual tournament bracket: https://challonge.com/summerauxy2018
Good luck all! I will post the first challenge as soon as sign ups are full. __________________

item.description:
I’d prefer if nobody ran a tournament without me. It’s kinda like my thing, I put a lot of work into creating these. Plus I talked about the schedules with MisterMaster and we decided it’s best to run tournaments with space in between so there’s time for other unicorn challenges, big events and time for winners to be winners.

item.title: [CONTEST] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K18!
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
Woah. Those entries are incredible! It was super difficult to pick a winner, but here we are with a decision.

First off, I wanted to thank everybody who helped run the tournament (@Andrew_Adams, @NotMiles, @MisterMaster). You guys were a huge help! I’d also like to congratulate every one who entered. You’ve submitted some awesome entries this time around!!

So, let’s get down to it.

@TC64, @MR_ANDERSON, you guys really blew me away in this tournament. This really was a crazy match, seeing as you’re two of the highest scoring people ever to enter these tournaments. It was really hard to judge this round, but ultimately, we’ve picked a winner.

And the winner is…

ToxicCaves64!

Huge congratulations. Your entries always blew me away with the intricate composition and layers. Your stuff was always top notch and those melodies were off the charts!

Mr. Anderson, you really impressed me this tournament! Your chords are absolutely incredible, and as Andrew Adams said, you have great sound design.

Thanks so much, everybody! You’re all winners in my eyes.

See you next year for another tournament. Take care!

Read full topic

item.title: [CONTEST] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K18!
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
Wow gentlemen…great work the judges have a difficult time in head of them.
@TC64 I love the sort of video game feel you gave yours, and the wahwah automations you give around 1:55 go so well with the kicks and fuzzy bass lines. The upbeat melody with a slightly melancholy undertone is brilliant composing. The piano intro and outro make the song a complete work. Fantastic job my dude.
@MR_ANDERSON the arpeggios are fantastic and make the aaahs and oohhs really pop. Then the synths build really nice before the automation bring you into a trippy summer party and back to reality as the vox calms you to before it drops into the realization that summer is almost over.

Love both tracks. I think my vote is for. Wait for it…

Read full topic

item.title: [CONTEST] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K18!
item.dc:creator: TC64
item.description:
https://soundcloud.com/ToxicCaves64/Sunfall

When I thought about the kind of song I wanted to create to express the ending of this year’s summer, I wanted something that sounded huge and super fun, but I also wanted it to have it’s quieter moments, to peacefully transition into the fall.

Sunfall starts off with a solo piano intro, and then transitions into a simple melody that is mostly in major, but sometimes switches to minor to represent the feeling of summer slowing down, ready to end soon. The melody continues into the first verse, which follows the same principles with a slightly jazzier feel.

After the verse, the lead-in section plays. It starts off using slower notes to give off a relaxing feel, but before you know it, all of the existing instruments and a newly-added square wave riser and drum fill start to build.

Summer’s not over yet.

The drop uses heavy future bass-style synths, and it’s accentuated with a marimba/pizzicato strings-based lead and an inspiring chord progression.

After the drop, the song slows back down again, keeping the melody but dropping the synth arpeggios and leads. This section represents the final days of summer.

Finally, everything else comes to a stop, and slow piano begins to play. This is the final day of summer. You’re watching the sun set, ready for Fall to start. A quiet “plink” sound in the high range of the piano represents the first falling leaves.

And then the last bit of sunlight fades away.

Read full topic

item.title: [CONTEST] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K18!
item.dc:creator: MR_ANDERSON
item.description:
https://soundcloud.com/mrandersonauxy/final-round

Well, that took a long time. To those who have waited too long for this, I apologize! I hope that this song fulfills your expectations.

I created this song such that every facet of it would reflect part of my summer experiences. The song starts out bright and happy, depicting the joys of the beginning of a new summer. It immediately moves into a more deep, relaxed section, which, fittingly, reflects the deep relaxation I found in the break from school. The song then drops off into a section building tension towards the drop. This part describes my building anticipation of the vacation our family would take in August (which I just returned from ). Finally, after the drop, the song returns to its previous relaxed state, and declines in mood from there as the summer ends and the weight of my senior year in high school sets in.

The key and chord progression were both meant to describe my mixed emotions about this summer, from the happiness and relaxation of family vacations, to the uncertainty of the path ahead of me with high school ending in a year and college beginning. And while this song was not the longest, I meant for it to be this way, as it accurately tells of my opinion that this summer was, well, too short!

With that, I bring you all my final entry to this summer’s tournament! And I also must add, that this tournament will unfortunately be my last. As previously stated, school is starting soon, and that takes priority over music (usually). That being said, I hope that these tournaments continue, as they always provide those who enter with amazing musical inspiration! Thanks to both the judges, @DHO and @Andrew_Adams, who both poured out so much time and effort into these tournaments. And, hey, if you guys ever need another judge for stuff like this, I’d love to help!

Mr. Anderson

Read full topic
